p: Compared to the control rats, MIA’s intra-articular injection caused a significant reduction of paw withdrawal latencies to heat stimuli (Fig. 1c). Statistical analysis showed that the difference between the CO and OA groups on days 4, 7, and 14 after the injection is significant ( P < 0.001). All treatments significantly increased the withdrawal latency compared to the osteoarthritis group ( P < 0.01). Also, the data analysis showed that the anti-nociceptive effect of nanoemulsion was higher than essential oil gel ( P < 0.05), and the difference between the NG and DG groups was not significant ( P = 0.09).
